description.dataset: Name of the dataset. The title needs to be short and easily recognizable and searchable. If there is an acronym, please also provide the long name.
description.experiment: Name of the experiment. The title needs to be short and easily recognizable and searchable. If there is an acronym, please also provide the long name.

description.dataset: The person(s) or organization(s) that contributed to the creation of the dataset. This can be the principal investigator, hospital, university, centre, clinic, etc. The first contact provided will be associated as the main contact for this dataset.
description.experiment: The person(s) or organization(s) that contributed to the creation of the experiment. This can be the principal investigator, hospital, university, centre, clinic, etc. The first contact provided will be associated as the main contact for this experiment.

description.dataset: A short paragraph providing an overview of the dataset and the context of data collection. Suggestion of items to include (if applicable) are: main use of the dataset, population studied, study design, sample size, data collected, methods, techniques, apparatus used to generate the data. Ideally, the first sentence of the description should give a good overall description of the dataset.
description.experiment: A short paragraph providing a rapid overview of the experiment and the context of data collection. Suggestion of items to include (if applicable) are: main procedure of the experiment, population studied, experimental design, data collected, methods, techniques, apparatus used to generate the outputs. Ideally, the first sentence of the description should give a good overall description of the experiment.

description.dataset: Terms to describe the nature of the data. Data type can be single or multiple. Add a term with the Interlex lexicon of biomedical terms if possible.
description.experiment: Terms to describe the nature of the data produced by the experiment (e.g., csv, audio recording, video recording). Data type can be single or multiple. Add a term with the Interlex lexicon of biomedical terms if possible.

description.dataset: Provide the version number, or the release point of your dataset. If you do not have an existing versioning convention, we recommend the use of the following versoning convention: 1.0=original dataset; 1.1=minor revisions made to the dataset; 1.2=further minor revisions; 2.0=major/substantive changes to the dataset. For example: minor changes could include corrupted file or link fixes, more description/documentation of the dataset and so on; Major changes would include additional data released (more subjects, more modalities and so on)
description.experiment: Provide the version number, or the release point of your experiment. If you do not have an existing versioning convention, we recommend the use of the following versoning convention: 1.0=original experiment; 1.1=minor revisions made to the experiment; 1.2=further minor revisions; 2.0=major/substantive changes to the experiment. For example: minor changes could include bug fixes, more description/documentation of the experiment and so on; Major changes would include additional experimental features (more stimuli or trials, more modalities and so on)

description.dataset:
A qualifier to describe the data protection applied to the dataset. This must be one of "open", "registered", "controlled" or "private".
  • open: freely and publicly available
  • registered: available to bona fide researchers/clinical care professionals only
  • controlled: available to qualified researchers approved by a committee after review of their research proposal; also known as managed or restricted access
  • private: available only to researchers of the project; also known as closed
Permission to access "registered" and "controlled" is given by the creator. In the context of an experiment, this refers to the privacy levels assigned to the experiment itself rather than any data generated by or included with the experiment.
description.experiment:
A qualifier to describe the data protection applied to the experiment. This is relevant for experimental stimuli taken from external sources.
  • open: freely and publicly available
  • registered: available to bona fide researchers/clinical care professionals only
  • controlled: available to qualified researchers approved by a committee after review of their research proposal; also known as managed or restricted access
  • private: available only to researchers of the project; also known as closed

description.dataset: The licences under which this dataset is shared. A drop-down list of licence options should be provided in the relevant editor interface.
description.experiment: The licences under which this experiment is shared. Note, this applies to the experimental files themselves and not the data that would be generated from the experiment. Visit Choose a License for more information on open-source licenses.

description.dataset: Tags associated with the dataset, which will help in its discovery. These should be well known terms in the research community.
description.experiment: Tags associated with the experiment, which will help in its discovery. These should be well known terms in the research community.

description.dataset: The technical format of the dataset distribution. Use the file extension or MIME type when possible. (Definition adapted from DataCite).
description.experiment: The technical format of the data generated from the experiment. Use the file extension or MIME type when possible. (Definition adapted from DataCite).

description.dataset: The quantity of space required on disk (or other medium) for this dataset.
description.experiment: The quantity of space required on disk (or other medium) for this experiment.

units.name: Units
units.description: Unit in which the size is measured.(KB -> KiloByte, MB -> MegaByte, GB -> GigaByte, TB -> TeraByte and PB -> PetaByte).

description.dataset: The information about access modality for the dataset distribution.
description.experiment: The information about access modality for the experiment distribution.

description.dataset: A URL (Web page) that contains information about the associated dataset (with a link to the dataset) or a direct link to the dataset itself. When none exists yet, please provide the link to the README.md file of the dataset.
description.experiment: A URL (Web page) that contains information about the associated experiment (with a link to the experiment) or a direct link to the experiment itself. This could be a link to the GitHub, OSF, or Zenodo repository containing the experiment files, a lab website, or faculty page. When none exists yet, please enter "README.md."

authorizations.name: Authorizations
authorizations.description: This must be one of "Public", "Registered" or "Private". When this field is absent the value will be treated as "Public". "Public" = available to anyone; "Registered" = available to user authorized by the creator; "Private" = available only to the creator.

description.dataset: Total number of files in the dataset.
description.experiment: Total number of files in the experiment.

description.dataset: Total number of subjects constituting the dataset. As well as numbers, "N/A" is a valid value in cases where this does not apply, eg, expression of human proteins in microbial systems.
description.experiment: Total number of subjects constituting the experiment. If not applicable, please uncheck the box.

description.dataset: The CONP status is used to add the CONP logo or Canadian flag on the left of the dataset and sorting in the data search. Valid values are "CONP" = created using funding from the CONP; "Canadian" = created in Canada without CONP funding; "external" = created outside of Canada.
description.experiment: The CONP status is used to add the CONP logo or Canadian flag on the left of the experiment and sorting in the data search. Valid values are "CONP" = created using funding from the CONP; "Canadian" = created in Canada without CONP funding; "external" = created outside of Canada.

description.dataset: Name of the institution or consortium that generated the dataset. Both an institution and a consortium can be specified, e.g. in the case of a named collaboration between different labs at the same institution.
description.experiment: Name of the institution or consortium that generated the experiment. Both an institution and a consortium can be specified, e.g. in the case of a named collaboration between different labs at the same institution.

description.dataset: Name of the institution where this dataset was created (if applicable).
description.experiment: Name of the institution where this experiment was created (if applicable).

description.dataset: Name of the consortium where this dataset was created (if applicable).
description.experiment: Name of the consortium where this experiment was created (if applicable).

description.dataset: (Principal) city where this dataset was created.
description.experiment: (Principal) city where this experiment was created.

description.dataset: (Principal) province where this dataset was created.
description.experiment: (Principal) province where this experiment was created (if applicable).

description.dataset: (Principal) country where this dataset was created.
description.experiment: (Principal) country where this experiment was created.

description.dataset: Required for derived datasets only. Provide information about the source dataset this dataset has been derived from.
description.experiment: Required for derived experiments only. Provide information about the source experiment this experiment has been derived from.

description.dataset: Name of the source dataset used to generate this dataset.
description.experiment: Name of the source experiment used to generate this experiment.

description.dataset: Identifier (DOI, ARK, or other persistent identifier) of the source dataset used to generate this dataset.
description.experiment: Identifier (DOI, ARK, or other persistent identifier) of the source experiment used to generate this experiment.

description.dataset: The primary publication(s) associated with the dataset, usually describing how the dataset was produced.
description.experiment: The primary publication(s) associated with the experiment, usually describing how the experiment was produced.

primaryPublications.publicationVenue.name: Publication Venue
primaryPublications.publicationVenue.description: The name of the publication venue where the document is published (if applicable).

primaryPublications.dates.name: Dates
primaryPublications.dates.description: Relevant dates for the publication. If you provide a date, it must come with a description (i.e. first submission, final approval, date of publication, etc.).

primaryPublications.identifier.identifie.name: Identifier
primaryPublications.identifier.identifie.description: A code uniquely identifying the publication locally to a system or globally. Provide a Document Object Identifier (DOI) or Archival Resource Key (ARK) if you have one.

primaryPublications.identifier.identifie.name: Identifier Source
primaryPublications.identifier.identifie.description: Information about the organisation/namespace responsible for minting the identifier. It must be provided if the identifier is provided.

description.dataset: The different dimensions (granular components) making up a dataset. Providing dimensions give more details about the data types.
description.experiment: The different dimensions (granular components) making up a experiment. Providing dimensions give more details about the data types.

description.dataset: A code uniquely identifying the dataset locally to a system or globally.
description.experiment: A code (e.g., digital object identifier, DOI) uniquely identifying the experiment locally to a system or globally.

identifier.identifierSource.name: Source
identifier.identifierSource.description: Information about the organisation/namespace responsible for minting the identifier. It must be provided if the identifier is provided.

description.dataset: Link to a URL for the logo or local filename containing the logo.
description.experiment: Relative path and filename (e.g., logo.png, info/logo.jpg) containing the logo within the experimental files (recommended) or link to a URL for the logo.

registrationPage.name: Registration Page
registrationPage.description: If the dataset “Privacy” field above has been set to either 'registered', 'controlled', or 'private', please provide the URL of the registration page where users can obtain access credentials or the email of a contact person who manages access.

description.dataset: Relevant dates for the dataset. If you provide a date, it must come with a description of the date (i.e.: first data collection, last data collection, date of first publication, ...).
description.experiment: Relevant dates for the experiment. If you provide a date, it must come with a description of the date (i.e.: version date, development start date, development end date, date of first publication, ...).

description.dataset: Provide contact information (name and email address) of the person responsible for the dataset.
description.experiment: Provide contact information (name and email address) of the person responsible for the experiment.

description.dataset: Process which generated a given dataset.

Entities (biological entity, taxonomic information, disease, molecular entity, anatomical part, treatment) associated with this dataset. You must provide a species, and other entities are optional. Disease state information to be entered here.
description.experiment: Entities (biological entity, taxonomic information, disease, disease state, molecular entity, anatomical part, treatment) associated with this experiment. You must provide a species; other entities are optional. Disease state information to be entered here.

description.dataset: Grant(s) which funded and supported the work reported by the dataset.
description.experiment: Grant(s) which funded and supported the work reported by the experiment. Contributors to the experiment not listed as creators.

description.dataset: The geographical extension and span (i.e.: city, province, administrative region, ...) covered by the dataset.
description.experiment: The geographical extension and span (i.e.: city, province, administrative region, ...) covered by the experiment.

description.dataset: In submitting this dataset for inclusion, I declare that
description.experiment: In submitting this experiment for inclusion, I declare that I am not uploading any participant data and the only files included are those necessary to run the experiment.
One or more functions primarily assessed by the experiment. More detailed functions can be included as keywords in the General Info section.
One or more modalities (e.g. fMRI, EEG, MEG, behavioural) in which the experiment is performed.
Software and version required to run the experiment
Software required to run the experiment.
Software version required to run the experiment.
Hardware used to run the experiment. This should include the operating system on which the software was run, and any specific instruments needed to measure participant responses.
Operating system(s) the experiment can be run on (e.g. Windows, iOS, Linux).
Types of stimuli used for the experiment (e.g., audio, video, image).
Language(s) in which the experiment can be performed.
Validation measure(s) and population(s)
Measures used to validate the experiment
Populations for which the experiment is valid.
Accessibility considerations addressed during experimental development (e.g. colourblind friendly).
Any additional requirements for the experiment.
